com.pump.geom.intersect

Interface IntersectionIdentifier.IntersectionListener

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    IntersectionIdentifier.SimpleIntersectionListener
    Enclosing class:
    IntersectionIdentifier

    public static interface IntersectionIdentifier.IntersectionListener
    An interface to receive intersection information as it is observed.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void cubicCubicIntersection(double[] results, int size, int segmentIndex1, int segmentIndex2, double lastX1, double lastY1, double cx1a, double cy1a, double cx1b, double cy1b, double x1, double y1, double lastX2, double lastY2, double cx2a, double cy2a, double cx2b, double cy2b, double x2, double y2)
      This method is invoked for intersections where the segment from the first shape is a cubic segment and the segment from the second shape is a cubic segment.
      void cubicLineIntersection(double[] results, int size, int segmentIndex1, int segmentIndex2, double lastX1, double lastY1, double cx1a, double cy1a, double cx1b, double cy1b, double x1, double y1, double lastX2, double lastY2, double x2, double y2)
      This method is invoked for intersections where the segment from the first shape is a cubic segment and the segment from the second shape is a line segment.
      void cubicQuadraticIntersection(double[] results, int size, int segmentIndex1, int segmentIndex2, double lastX1, double lastY1, double cx1a, double cy1a, double cx1b, double cy1b, double x1, double y1, double lastX2, double lastY2, double cx2, double cy2, double x2, double y2)
      This method is invoked for intersections where the segment from the first shape is a cubic segment and the segment from the second shape is a quadratic segment.
      void lineCubicIntersection(double[] results, int size, int segmentIndex1, int segmentIndex2, double lastX1, double lastY1, double x1, double y1, double lastX2, double lastY2, double cx2a, double cy2a, double cx2b, double cy2b, double x2, double y2)
      This method is invoked for intersections where the segment from the first shape is a line segment and the segment from the second shape is a cubic segment.

    • Method Detail

      • lineLineIntersection

        void lineLineIntersection(double[] results,
                          int size,
                          int segmentIndex1,
                          int segmentIndex2,
                          double lastX1,
                          double lastY1,
                          double x1,
                          double y1,
                          double lastX2,
                          double lastY2,
                          double x2,
                          double y2)
        This method is invoked for intersections where the segment from the first shape is a line segment and the segment from the second shape is a line segment.
        Parameters:
        results - the results array. Every 4 numbers in this array contain information about a single intersection: { x-value, y-value, t1, t2}
        size - the number of intersections presented in the results array.
        segmentIndex1 - the index of the segment within the first shape.
        segmentIndex2 - the index of the segment within the second shape.
        lastX1 - the starting x-value of the the first segment.
        lastY1 - the starting y-value of the the first segment.
        x1 - the ending x-value of the first segment.
        y1 - the ending y-value of the first segment.
        lastX2 - the starting x-value of the the second segment.
        lastY2 - the starting y-value of the the second segment.
        x2 - the ending x-value of the second segment.
        y2 - the ending y-value of the second segment.

      • lineQuadraticIntersection

        void lineQuadraticIntersection(double[] results,
                               int size,
                               int segmentIndex1,
                               int segmentIndex2,
                               double lastX1,
                               double lastY1,
                               double x1,
                               double y1,
                               double lastX2,
                               double lastY2,
                               double cx2,
                               double cy2,
                               double x2,
                               double y2)
        This method is invoked for intersections where the segment from the first shape is a line segment and the segment from the second shape is a quadratic segment.
        Parameters:
        results - the results array. Every 4 numbers in this array contain information about a single intersection: { x-value, y-value, t1, t2}
        size - the number of intersections presented in the results array.
        segmentIndex1 - the index of the segment within the first shape.
        segmentIndex2 - the index of the segment within the second shape.
        lastX1 - the starting x-value of the the first segment.
        lastY1 - the starting y-value of the the first segment.
        x1 - the ending x-value of the first segment.
        y1 - the ending y-value of the first segment.
        lastX2 - the starting x-value of the the second segment.
        lastY2 - the starting y-value of the the second segment.
        cx2 - the x-value of the bezier control point in the second segment.
        cy2 - the y-value of the bezier control point in the second segment.
        x2 - the ending x-value of the second segment.
        y2 - the ending y-value of the second segment.

        This method is invoked for intersections where the segment from the first shape is a quadratic segment and the segment from the second shape is a cubic segment.
        Parameters:
        results - the results array. Every 4 numbers in this array contain information about a single intersection: { x-value, y-value, t1, t2}
        size - the number of intersections presented in the results array.
        segmentIndex1 - the index of the segment within the first shape.
        segmentIndex2 - the index of the segment within the second shape.
        lastX1 - the starting x-value of the the first segment.
        lastY1 - the starting y-value of the the first segment.
        cx1 - the x-value of the bezier control point in the first segment.
        cy1 - the y-value of the bezier control point in the first segment.
        x1 - the ending x-value of the first segment.
        y1 - the ending y-value of the first segment.
        lastX2 - the starting x-value of the the second segment.
        lastY2 - the starting y-value of the the second segment.

        cy2a - the y-value of the first bezier control point in the second segment.
        cx2b - the x-value of the second bezier control point in the second segment.
        cy2b - the y-value of the second bezier control point in the second segment.
        x2 - the ending x-value of the second segment.
        y2 - the ending y-value of the second segment.

        This method is invoked for intersections where the segment from the first shape is a cubic segment and the segment from the second shape is a cubic segment.
        Parameters:
        results - the results array. Every 4 numbers in this array contain information about a single intersection: { x-value, y-value, t1, t2}
        size - the number of intersections presented in the results array.
        segmentIndex1 - the index of the segment within the first shape.
        segmentIndex2 - the index of the segment within the second shape.
        lastX1 - the starting x-value of the the first segment.
        lastY1 - the starting y-value of the the first segment.
        cx1a - the x-value of the first bezier control point in the first segment.
        cy1a - the y-value of the first bezier control point in the first segment.
        cx1b - the x-value of the second bezier control point in the first segment.
        cy1b - the y-value of the second bezier control point in the first segment.
        x1 - the ending x-value of the first segment.
        y1 - the ending y-value of the first segment.
        lastX2 - the starting x-value of the the second segment.
        lastY2 - the starting y-value of the the second segment.

        cy2a - the y-value of the first bezier control point in the second segment.
        cx2b - the x-value of the second bezier control point in the second segment.
        cy2b - the y-value of the second bezier control point in the second segment.
        x2 - the ending x-value of the second segment.
        y2 - the ending y-value of the second segment.

        Parameters:
        results - the results array. Every 4 numbers in this array contain information about a single intersection: { x-value, y-value, t1, t2}
        size - the number of intersections presented in the results array.
        segmentIndex1 - the index of the segment within the first shape.
        segmentIndex2 - the index of the segment within the second shape.

        lastY1 - the starting y-value of the the first segment.
        cx1a - the x-value of the first bezier control point in the first segment.
        cy1a - the y-value of the first bezier control point in the first segment.

        cy1b - the y-value of the second bezier control point in the first segment.

        cy2 - the y-value of the bezier control point in the second segment.
        x2 - the ending x-value of the second segment.
        y2 - the ending y-value of the second segment.
